Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that independent voters in California can select the candidate of their choice, regardless of party affiliation, in the general election.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on a Facebook post that spreads misleading information.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that California's registered independent voters will not be able to vote Republican in 2020, which is not true according to the expert's verdict.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim falsely claims that California made the rules requiring a change of registration, while the expert's verdict explains that political parties decide whether independent voters can participate in their presidential primary elections every four years.
